intro: Tristania lactiflua, commonly known as the milkweed tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its milky sap, which gives it its common name, is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Tristania lactiflua is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
